title: 111_hr3766
content: The Act may be cited as the "Main Street TARP Act of 2009" and includes provisions for a Housing Trust Fund. The Main Street TARP Act of 2009 authorizes the transfer of $1 billion to the Housing Trust Fund for use in accordance with the Act. Amendments are made to ensure rent contributions from families in rental housing units. Amendments are made to ensure that a family's rent contribution does not exceed 30 percent of their adjusted income in rental housing units. SEC. 3. EMERGENCY MORTGAGE RELIEF. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer $2 billion to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for the Emergency Homeowners' Relief Fund to provide emergency mortgage assistance. The Emergency Housing Act of 1975 is amended to reauthorize the Emergency Mortgage Relief Program. The Emergency Housing Act of 1975 is amended to reauthorize the Emergency Mortgage Relief Program by certifying delinquent loans and adding medical conditions as adverse economic factors. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer $2 billion to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for emergency mortgage assistance. The Emergency Housing Act of 1975 is amended to reauthorize the Emergency Mortgage Relief Program by certifying delinquent loans and adding medical conditions as adverse economic factors. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer $2 billion to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for emergency mortgage assistance. In section 105, subsections are reorganized and the maximum amount is increased to $2 billion. The Emergency Housing Act of 1975 is amended to reauthorize the Emergency Mortgage Relief Program by certifying delinquent loans and adding medical conditions as adverse economic factors. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer $2 billion to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for emergency mortgage assistance. Sections 107 and 108 are amended to establish underwriting guidelines and allow funds to be administered by a State through an existing program. The Emergency Housing Act of 1975 is amended to reauthorize the Emergency Mortgage Relief Program by certifying delinquent loans and adding medical conditions as adverse economic factors. Sections 109 and 110 are revised, including the removal of certain subsections and redesignation of sections. SEC. 4. REDUCING TARP AUTHORIZATION LIMIT TO OFFSET COSTS by amending the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to increase the authorization limit.
